page.title: 01Brief History
page.content: Brief History In the Domesday Book of 1086 this area is known as "The Hundred of Henhert". The original settlement was a village called Drigsell which was positioned about 3/4 mile to the east of the present village of Robertsbridge. A Cistercian Abbey was built and the village was depopulated with the villagers being moved to a smaller settlement called Salehurst.Most were moved to a crossing point on the River Rother and the settlement of Rothersbridge was born. Salehurst is really two Anglo-Saxon words:-SEALTH meaning Willow and HURST meaning a Thick Wood.The parish has been known as Salehurst since the 14th Century.
